parameters.query:
-- Requ√™te SQL pour r√©cup√©rer les fichiers PHP par niveau de complexit√©
WITH complexity_levels AS (
  SELECT
    id,
    file_path,
    last_analyzed,
    complexity_score,
    loc,
    user_id,
    CASE
      WHEN complexity_score >= {{$node["Configuration avanc√©e"].json["complexityThresholds"]["critical"]}} THEN 'critical'
      WHEN complexity_score >= {{$node["Configuration avanc√©e"].json["complexityThresholds"]["high"]}} THEN 'high'
      WHEN complexity_score >= {{$node["Configuration avanc√©e"].json["complexityThresholds"]["medium"]}} THEN 'medium'
      ELSE 'low'
    END AS complexity_level,
    -- Extraction du r√©pertoire (tout avant le dernier slash)
    REGEXP_REPLACE(file_path, '/[^/]*$', '') AS directory
  FROM
    php_analysis.files
  WHERE
    last_analyzed > NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'
    AND complexity_score >= {{$node["Configuration avanc√©e"].json["complexityThresholds"]["medium"]}}
),
-- Regroupement par r√©pertoire pour les statistiques
directory_stats AS (
  SELECT
    directory,
    COUNT(*) AS file_count,
    AVG(complexity_score) AS avg_complexity,
    MAX(complexity_score) AS max_complexity,
    COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE complexity_level = 'critical') AS critical_files,
    COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE complexity_level = 'high') AS high_files,
    COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE complexity_level = 'medium') AS medium_files
  FROM
    complexity_levels
  GROUP BY
    directory
),
-- R√©cup√©ration des alertes existantes pour ne pas dupliquer
existing_alerts AS (
  SELECT
    file_id,
    severity,
    message
  FROM
    php_analysis.alerts
  WHERE
    alert_type = 'complexity'
    AND resolved = FALSE
)
-- Requ√™te principale avec toutes les donn√©es n√©cessaires
SELECT
  cl.id,
  cl.file_path,
  SPLIT_PART(cl.file_path, '/', -1) AS filename,
  cl.complexity_score,
  cl.loc,
  cl.last_analyzed,
  cl.complexity_level,
  cl.directory,
  ds.file_count AS directory_file_count,
  ds.avg_complexity AS directory_avg_complexity,
  ds.max_complexity AS directory_max_complexity,
  ds.critical_files AS directory_critical_files,
  ds.high_files AS directory_high_files,
  ds.medium_files AS directory_medium_files,
  -- V√©rifier si une alerte existe d√©j√† pour ce fichier
  EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM existing_alerts WHERE file_id = cl.id) AS has_existing_alert
FROM
  complexity_levels cl
JOIN
  directory_stats ds ON cl.directory = ds.directory
ORDER BY
  cl.complexity_score DESC, cl.complexity_level, cl.directory;

-- Ins√©rer les nouvelles alertes
INSERT INTO php_analysis.alerts
  (file_id, alert_type, severity, message, created_at, resolved)
SELECT
  (data->>'file_id')::uuid,
  data->>'alert_type',
  data->>'severity',
  data->>'message',
  (data->>'created_at')::timestamp with time zone,
  (data->>'resolved')::boolean
FROM json_array_elements({{ JSON.stringify($node["G√©n√©ration des notifications"].json["alertRecords"]) }}::json) AS data
RETURNING id;
